column1: # This is a submission template for batch deposit SRA metadata
#You can add as many files to a sample you wish by adding more columns with headers filename2, filename3,etc
#File names in the metadata must match the files that are upload, if you are uploading a tar file and you have directories, please specify the directory as part of the file name
#You can also add custom attributes to your data by adding more columns, the attributes will part of the Run

# CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates(it is best to format date fields as text), incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to SRA.
#     1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application)
#     2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)'
#     3. Upload the file on the SRA metadata tab of the SRA Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/sra/.
#     4. If you have any questions, please contact us at sra@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

column3: Random sequencing of the whole genome following non-pcr amplification
Random sequencing of the whole genome

column7: Sequencing of hypersensitive sites, or segments of open chromatin that are more readily cleaved by DNaseI

column3: Random sequencing of exonic regions selected from the genome
column5: Sequencing of overlapping or distinct PCR or RT-PCR products
column7: Sequencing following treatment of DNA with bisulfite to convert cytosine residues to uracil depending on methylation status

column5: Sequencing intended to finish (close) gaps in existing coverage
column7: Single pass sequencing of cDNA templates
column9: Library strategy not listed (please include additional info in the “design description”)

Genomic DNA (includes PCR products from genomic DNA)

column3: Transcription products or non genomic DNA (EST, cDNA, RT-PCR, screened libraries)

column6: Source material was selected by randomly generated primers
column14: Library enrichment, screening, or selection is not specified (please include additional info in the “design description”)

column10: Selection by hybridization in array or solution
Reproducible genomic subsets, often generated by restriction fragment size selection, containing a manageable number of loci to facilitate re-sampling
